sols_html:
First we take the derivative of the function.

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle f'(x) = 2x - 6\end{aligned}\]

To find the slope of the tangent line at the point (a, a2 - 6a), we simply need to plug the value x = a into the derivative. This gives:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle f'(a) = 2a - 6\end{aligned}\]

So the slope of the tangent line is 2a - 6.
